Liked that the app found my music folders with no input from me. It's the easiest to set up. Then when I turn the screen back on, I have to bring the main screen back up.

Read the app's description:

"embedded covers" means the app retrieves covers from tags only and no other sources. So, embed the covers into the files tags.

The drawbacks are: it pauses permanently while playing & you click on a video or audio on whatsapp, facebook or twitter. Even when you end or pause the other app's play, you still need to manually restart your main song on Music Player Go. The 2nd drawback is that you can't create playlists. The 3rd is that it have a 'Recently Added' folder. But one good thing about Music Player Go is that it shows even hidden songs other players won't show when you search for them. Awesome app. It needs a default sort option. It sucks having to always sort my track number in every album. The precise volume control is amazing. My phone doesn't have enough volume intervals so this really helps. No WMA support though.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, this is a limit of the native Android MediaPlayer API used, so it's not a fault of the app. wma is a closed format and its support depend on some libraries not always available on Android devices, and they're not part of the AOSP itself. I'm sorry, hope You will understand and change the rating. Thanks :)

google_play_reviews.content: If there's a way to turn off shuffle, let me know and I'll change it to 5 stars. If there isn't --- sorry, that's a dealbreaker. That should be the most basic feature in a music player.

google_play_reviews.content: Some features I consider to be basic are missing. I.e. üîªFolders are viewable in a list only. Three view missing. So, songs there should be listed as "artist - song name", not as "track number - song name" (or that option should be available). üîª Sorting files by time modified is pretty much basic IMO
